paper_abstract: The objective of this paper is to systematically study the qualitative behavior of solutions of the nonlinear delay population model [GRAPHICS] where p(n) and q(n) are positive periodic sequences of period omega, m, and omega are positive integers and omega > 1. First, by using the continuation theorem in conincidence degree theory, we establish a sufficient condition for the existence of a positive omega-periodic solution (x) over bar (n) with strictly positive components. Second, we establish some sufficient conditions for oscillation of the positive solutions about a periodic solution. Finally, we give an estimation of the lower and upper bounds of the oscillatory solutions and establish some sufficient conditions for the global attractivity of {(x) over bar (n)}. Some illustrative examples are included to demonstrate the validity and applicability of the results. (c) 2008 Published by Elsevier Ltd.
paper_title: Periodic solutions, oscillation and attractivity of discrete nonlinear delay population model
